title: Covid-19 Vaccine Frequently Asked Questions
content:
While it is the
recommended
to get 2024-2025 COVID-19 vaccine doses 6 months apart, the
minimum
time is 2 months apart, which allows flexibility to get the second dose prior to typical COVID-19 surges, travel, life events, and healthcare visits.
If I am pregnant or planning to become pregnant, can I get a COVID-19 vaccine?
Yes, COVID-19 vaccination is recommended if you are
pregnant
,
breastfeeding a baby
, trying to get pregnant now, or
might become pregnant in the future
.
